name: Goodys
review: Excellent smash burger. The bun is delicious fluffly and holds together well. The patty is perfectly seasoned with a nice crust. The secret is sauce is delicious and adds well to the overall taste. Only negative point is that the even double burger is a bit small.
seoReview: At Goodys in Zurich, the Classic Cheeseburger stands out as an exceptional example of the smash burger style. Priced at 18.9 CHF, this meal offers legendary value for such high-quality execution. The experience begins with a delicious, fluffy bun that maintains its structural integrity until the very last bite. The heart of the burger is the patty, which is seasoned perfectly and boasts an impressive crust, showcasing expert technique on the grill. This is elevated further by a secret sauce that integrates beautifully with the other ingredients, creating a cohesive and flavorful profile. While the portions lean toward the smaller side, even with a double patty, the concentration of flavor is remarkable. For those in Zurich seeking a well-crafted burger where every component from the bread to the meat is handled with care, this offering is highly recommended as a top-tier choice for enthusiasts of the craft.
seoVerdict: A masterfully executed smash burger in Zurich offering legendary flavor and value.

name: Burgermeister
review: Best burger in zurich. Fantastic bun. Extremely tasty meat. Excellent Sauce. Never disappoints. Top Tier burger worldwide. POtato bun.
seoReview: Finding the definitive burger in Zurich often feels like an endless quest, but Burgermeister consistently sets the gold standard. Their signature cheeseburger centers around a patty that is flawlessly seasoned and seared, capturing an intensity of beefy flavor that is exceptionally rare. This is cradled in a pillowy potato bun that maintains its structural integrity while absorbing just the right amount of juice. Complemented by a rich sauce that perfectly ties the savory components together, it is a masterclass in balance and execution. For those seeking a reliable, high-quality meal that transcends local hype, this remains an essential destination for any serious enthusiast.
seoVerdict: The undisputed gold standard for burgers in the heart of Zurich.

name: Sando
review: Very good burger. The meat is very juicy and full of flavor. The bun is delicious and soft, it soaks up with the sauce a bit too fast which makes this burger messy too eat. The sauce is special and tasty. Altough I personally didnt really like the miso flavor in the burger this burger still tasted great.
shortVerdict: Excellent burger with a special touch
seoReview: Located in Zurich, Sando offers a sophisticated take on the burger with their Miso Bacon Double. At 22 CHF, the price reflects its premium ingredients and creative flair. The heart of the experience is the beef patty, which is remarkably juicy and delivers a deep, savory punch. It is paired with a soft bun that is both delicious and light, though its porous nature soaks up the signature sauce quite rapidly, creating a rich and somewhat messy experience. The sauce itself brings a unique profile to the dish, incorporating distinct miso notes that provide a savory depth, even if the flavor profile is quite specific. Despite the slightly higher price point, the quality of the meat and the thoughtful construction make this a highly recommended choice for enthusiasts looking for a refined burger in the city.
seoVerdict: A high-quality, juicy burger with unique miso flavors in central Zurich.

name: The Bite
review: Fantastic burger. Restaurant not takeout. Fun vibe. Great taste. Excellent fries to accomodate the dining experience
seoReview: The Bite in Zurich offers a premium dining experience for those who appreciate a burger crafted with care. The Classic features a robust patty paired with a well-structured bun and a flavorful sauce that balances every bite. Unlike a typical takeout spot, the restaurant boasts a vibrant atmosphere that makes it a great choice for a social evening. While the cost reflects the upscale market, the inclusion of exceptionally crispy fries elevates the meal into a complete, high-quality dining event.
seoVerdict: A well-executed burger classic served in a vibrant, sit-down restaurant setting.

name: Huncho
review: The bun smells like a bun from burger king but tastes dramatically better. It is fluffy and delightful. The meat tastes great. The outside was a bit dry bit crunchy. The meat is well seasoned but lacks distinctive flavor. The sauce is good. A little bit too much of a cocktail hint but overall great. The overall burger is very good and enjoyable. Very good burger. Lacks a bit of distinction but is very good. Good Smash Burger
shortVerdict: Great Smash burger. Not distinctive but great.
seoReview: Huncho in Zurich offers a refined take on the classic smash burger with their signature Huncho Burger. Priced at 23 CHF, the experience reflects a premium value for money within the city. The standout element is undoubtedly the bun, which is remarkably fluffy and delightful, providing a high-quality foundation for the meal. The meat is well-seasoned and features a well-executed, crunchy exterior, though it leans towards a traditional profile rather than a highly distinctive one. The accompanying sauce provides a familiar cocktail-inspired flavor that complements the savory patty well. While the burger lacks a unique signature punch, the overall construction is very good and consistently enjoyable. For those exploring Zurich's culinary scene, this smash burger delivers a balanced and savory experience through quality ingredients and expert preparation. It is a solid, highly recommended choice for burger enthusiasts looking for a reliable and well-made meal.
seoVerdict: A premium Zurich smash burger featuring an exceptionally fluffy and delightful bun.

name: Black Tap
review: Big burger. Special burger combinations. Great taste. Feels special
seoReview: Located in the heart of Zurich, Black Tap delivers a burger experience that stands out for its sheer scale and creative flair. The All American burger is a testament to classic flavors, featuring a well-prepared patty nestled in a fresh bun that maintains its structural integrity. While the sauce provides a solid foundation, the overall composition makes the meal feel like a special occasion. For those seeking a substantial meal that balances craft with impressive portions, this spot offers a level of satisfaction that is increasingly hard to find in the city's food scene.
seoVerdict: A massive, high-quality burger that delivers an exceptionally satisfying dining experience.

name: Holy Cow
review: Juicy Meat, feels fresh. Bun is also very good amd fresh. Price is reasonable. This burger had bbq sauce. This sauce felt too sweet for the burger and overpowered the meat. Maybe i will try different sauce next time.
shortVerdict: Good Juicy Burger. Not ideal sauce
seoReview: At Holy Cow in Zurich, the Smoky Big Cheese stands out as a solid example of a fresh Swiss burger experience. Priced at 15.4 CHF, this meal offers great value for money, especially given the quality of the core ingredients. The burger features a notably well-executed bun that feels remarkably fresh and provides a sturdy foundation for the meal. The beef patty is a highlight, delivering a juicy texture and a fresh taste that suggests high-quality meat. However, the overall balance is slightly impacted by the barbecue sauce. While flavorful, the sauce is quite sweet and tends to overpower the natural savoriness of the meat. Despite the dominant sweetness of the topping, the quality of the bread and the patty makes it a satisfying choice in the city. For those visiting Holy Cow, it is a reliable option, though diners who prefer a more meat-forward profile might consider exploring different sauce pairings on their next visit.
seoVerdict: A juicy Zurich burger with a fresh bun, slightly hindered by sweet sauce.

name: Action Burger
review: Good burger. The bun is a bit dry but tastes ok. The meat is very good, well seasoned with a nice crust but still juicy. The sauce is just ketchup and moustard. While this is ok it misses to deliver a certain punch.
shortVerdict: Ok burger. Good meat, a bit dry bun, average sauce
seoReview: Action Burger in Zurich offers a solid take on the classic Double Cheeseburger, providing great value at 17.5 CHF. The highlight of this meal is undoubtedly the meat; the patties are expertly seasoned, featuring a satisfyingly crisp crust while maintaining a juicy interior. While the protein carries the experience, other elements are more functional. The bun is serviceable but leans slightly dry, lacking the pillowy texture found in top-tier burgers. For the sauce, the kitchen keeps it simple with a classic combination of ketchup and mustard. While traditional, this pairing lacks a signature punch that could elevate the dish further. Overall, it is a well-executed burger that prioritizes high-quality meat and value for money. For those in Zurich seeking a reliable, hearty meal without over-complicated toppings, this location delivers a dependable experience where the seasoned beef truly shines.
seoVerdict: Excellent juicy patties make this Zurich burger a high-value, reliable choice.

name: Bourger Boutique
review: Solid burger, the bun is fluffy and flavorful, the patty is not smashed but regular, very juicy but lacks the special something factor and seasoning. The sauce is good not overpowering the burger taste. While the sauce is very good it lacks distinction. What was very welcome distinction was their use of a regular cucumber instead of pickles. Makes the burger feels fresh and different.
seoReview: Bourger Boutique in Zurich offers a reliable experience with their Der Speckige burger. The standout feature is undoubtedly the bun—exceptionally fluffy and packed with flavor, providing a premium foundation for the meal. While the patty arrives juicy, it follows a traditional thick style rather than a smash, and it lacks the aggressive seasoning needed to truly stand out in a competitive market. A refreshing twist comes from the substitution of standard pickles for fresh cucumber slices, lending a clean, crisp finish to every bite. The sauce complements the meat without overwhelming it, though it stops short of having a signature distinction. It is a well-constructed, fresh burger that hits the mark for quality without pushing the boundaries of innovation.
seoVerdict: Fresh ingredients and fluffy buns define this solid, reliable Zurich burger.

name: The Smash Burger Bear
review: The meat was slightly dry on the outside, but the overall flavor was good. The bun was fluffy, tasted great, and held everything together nicely. The sauce was enjoyable as well, though the cocktail-style flavor was a bit too strong for my taste. Overall, it was a very good burger. Not a top-tier favorite, but well balanced and flavorful. One note on presentation: the patty was oversized for the bun and barely fit into the packaging.
shortVerdict: A very good, well-flavored burger with a great bun and bold sauce, slightly held back by a dry exterior and an oversized patty.
seoReview: The Smash Cheese Burger at The Smash Burger Bear in Zurich delivers a robust flavor profile that hits many of the right notes. The highlight of the experience is the bun; it is remarkably fluffy, flavorful, and maintains its structural integrity against the weight of the ingredients. While the patty provides a deep, savory taste, the exterior was slightly over-seared, leading to a dry texture. Additionally, the meat was oversized for the bun, causing a bit of a mismatch in the presentation and packaging. The signature sauce leans into a bold, cocktail-style profile that offers a sharp kick, though it risks being a bit dominant for those who prefer the beef to take center stage. It remains a well-balanced and satisfying option for anyone seeking a quality smash burger in the city.
seoVerdict: Bold Zurich smash burger featuring a superb bun and oversized patty.

name: Smash Club
review: Delivery only smash burger. Good taste. Good option for delivery. Not a standout but good.
seoReview: Smash Club in Zurich offers a dependable delivery-only experience for fans of the classic smash burger. The Double Cheeseburger features well-seasoned patties and a bun that maintains its integrity during transport. While the flavor profile is consistent and the sauce adds a pleasant touch, it lacks the unique character of a standout destination meal. It remains a solid, high-value choice for a night in when you want a quality burger delivered without any unnecessary frills.
seoVerdict: A dependable Zurich delivery choice for a classic, well-executed smash burger.

name: Smash Burger Shahba Rose
review: The Smashburger is okay. The meat is actually very good. Very well seasoned, crispy, tastes nice. The sauce is okay. It's not overpowering the burger, but it's also not a standout sauce. The bun is really disappointing. It is very dry, doesn't have any good tastes to it. It feels very bland. The bun is really disappointing.
seoReview: If you find yourself in Zurich craving a Smash Double Cheeseburger, Smash Burger Shahba Rose offers a mixed experience. The highlight of this smash burger style meal is undoubtedly the meat. The patties are well-seasoned, featuring a nice crispiness that delivers on flavor and texture. However, while the beef excels, other components struggle to keep pace. The sauce is functional and provides a decent base without being overpowering, yet it fails to stand out as a signature element. The primary drawback is the bun, which unfortunately feels bland and notably dry, detracting from the overall enjoyment of the dish. Priced at 16.9 CHF, the value feels a bit steep when considering the inconsistency between the high-quality meat and the disappointing bread. It is a balanced meal that succeeds on the strength of its patties but leaves room for improvement in its presentation and components.
seoVerdict: High-quality crispy beef overshadowed by a dry and bland burger bun.

name: Burger King
review: Had this burger in Oerlikon. The bun is very dry. Also the meat was surprisingly dry as well. The meat is ok seasoned. But overall the burger is dry to eat and doesn‘t really leave any gret föavpurs to taste. The sauce is very standard ketchup and moustard, but the moustard taste was too strong.
seoReview: Visiting the Burger King in Zurich Oerlikon for a quick Cheeseburger, the experience was unfortunately defined by a lack of moisture. At 3.4 CHF, this fast-food staple is positioned as an affordable option, yet the quality falls short of expectations. The bun was notably dry and lacked the soft texture one hopes for in a classic burger. Similarly, the meat patty was surprisingly parched, though the seasoning itself was passable. The condiment profile relied on a standard combination of ketchup and mustard, but the mustard flavor was overly dominant, masking the other ingredients. While the price point suggests value for money, the overall execution leaves much to be desired. This particular Zurich location struggles to deliver a cohesive flavor profile, resulting in a burger that is difficult to enjoy due to its parched components and unbalanced sauce distribution.
seoVerdict: A dry, poorly balanced cheeseburger that fails to deliver despite the low price.
